description: From French revivifier, from Latin revivificare, corresponding to re- +â€Ž vivify.

verbs.description: revivify (third-person singular simple present revivifies, present participle revivifying, simple past and past participle revivified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reanimate, bring back to life.

examples: Despite the patrician allure of much that Choiseul attempted, a renovating, technocratic spirit was abroad during his tenure of office which sought to rationalize and revivify government service [...].

entries.meaning: (chemistry, transitive, now rare) To reactivate (a catalyst, reagent etc.).
(chemistry, intransitive, now rare) To become effective again as a reagent etc.
